intro: Coccoloba venosa, commonly known as the red mangrove or red bay, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in coastal areas, often growing in brackish or saltwater environments. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a velvety texture, while its fruits are small, three-lobed berries. Coccoloba venosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
